snippet: The Dwyer, which has attracted 75,000 visitors to visual art exhibitions, writers’ workshops, and music and theater performances — all free or low-cost — has run into major financial problems.
abstract: Dwyer Cultural Center in Harlem has run into major financial problems, forcing it to cut back severely on its free and low-cost educational programs and performances.
lead_paragraph: The Dwyer, which has attracted 75,000 visitors to visual art exhibitions, writers’ workshops, and music and theater performances — all free or low-cost — has run into major financial problems.

headline.seo: Dwyer Cultural Center in Harlem Tries to Stay Afloat
headline.main: A Dire Dance for a Harlem Cultural Center
headline.print_headline: A Dire Dance for a Harlem Cultural Center
